A strong dog is a mighty force, An invincible strength, An indomitable will. The roar of the lion, The howl of the wolf, The bark of the dog, A sound that is ringing in the soul. Courage to face the fears, The strength to go on, The determination never to give up, Never to give in. The power of the dog is an unbreakable bond, an unfailing love, an unquenchable friendship. The loyalty that never fails, The faith that never moves, The joy that is shared, the laughter that is ever loud. Let the power of the dog guide you on your journey, Let it be the beacon of light in the darkness. For with its power and its spirit, You will never be lonely, And with its love and its loyalty, You will never be sad, or mad, or blue.

I remember, as I walk along through the gardens, The scent of the holly tree, sweet and fine; It was as if I were living in a Vermeer painting. With every step the scent grew stronger, it filled my senses to the fullest, And from head to foot there was nothing but bliss, as the symphony of nature issued from its enclosure. This day remains forever in my memory, a symbol of my love for life, with all the riches that it may beget. And now I have before me a page, empty yet full—as if the patient waiting of time has given birth to a long-awaited inspiration. Let us go back there together again, where our hearts found refuge. Life leads us down paths unknown, we must be open to new vistas, but we know that deep within us is a rhythm divine that evermore will sound the infinite shore, where peace is the only guide for souls in search of home. Then we will continue, unafraid, Singing the Celestial Song.

One man used to be a proud and bold lad, Playing the chess game, **** *** ***. **** ***, *** ****. **** ***, **** ****, **** ***. **** ***, *** *** ***. *** ****, **** ****, *** **** ***. *** ****, *** *** ****, **** *** ***. **** ****, **** *** ***. *** *** ***. **** *** ***. *** ***. *** *** ***. *** ****, **** *** ***, *** *** ****, *** *** ****. **** ****, *** *** ***. Now at the twilight of life the embers are dim; The cherished memories of youth are gone with the mist. A name, once feared, now invoked with respect. A titan, humble but not defeated, stands before you, To receive the due tribute of thanks and to bid farewell, While his spirit lives on forever. In the history of legend he is an immortal, The dying old football champion.

Life after graduation is a journey, a long, winding road, with many choices and decisions to be made, and with paths unknown and unknown. It is a time for growth and exploration, a time to discover one's true passion and one's true self, a time to embrace the old friends who have stood the test of time, a time to embrace the beauty of the moment, and a time to make memories that will last a lifetime. It is a time to find one's true passion, a time to pursue dreams, a time to find power, a time to achieve one's own future. The time after graduation is a gift, a time to explore, a time to grow, a time to seize the day, a time to try and improve, a time to become a better self.

The ingredients are: 2 pounds of pork shoulder, cut into 12-inch cubes; 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil; 1 large onion, cut into dice; 4 cloves garlic, crushed; 2 cans of diced green peppers; 2 jalapeos, seeded and cut into cubes; 2 cans of chopped tomatoes; 2 cups of broth; 1 teaspoon of ground cumin; 1 teaspoon of ground oregano; Salt and pepper to taste; Chives for garnish; Lime wedges for garnish. Steps: 1 - In a saucepan heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil and sauté the meat in it until it has browned on all sides. Remove the meat and set aside. 2 - In the same saucepan, put the onion and garlic. Cook for 5 minutes, until the onion has turned clear and the garlic has begun to brown. 3 - Put in the pot the diced green peppers and jalapeos. Cook for 2 minutes. 4 - Put the browned meat in the pot and add the chopped tomatoes, broth, cumin and oregano. Salt and pepper to taste. Stir well. 5 - Bring to a boil and reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook for 2 or 3 hours, until the meat is tender and the flavors have blended. 6 - Taste and season with salt and pepper, if necessary. - Serve hot with a garnish of chive and lime wedges. Serve with warm corn bread or rice.

On the orange and orange peel stew: 1 kg of chicken thighs, cut into pieces, without the bone, 2 large onions, chopped, 4 cloves of garlic, chopped, 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil, 2 tablespoons of ground turmeric, 1 tablespoon of ground cinnamon, 1 tablespoon of ground cardamom, 1 tablespoon of cumin, 1 teaspoon of salt, 12 teaspoon of pepper, 1 cup of orange juice, 1 cup of broth, 2 tablespoons of honey, 2 tablespoons of tomato paste, 2 large oranges, peeled and cut into pieces, 2 tablespoons of honey, 2 tablespoons of tomato paste, 2 large oranges, peeled and cut into pieces, 2 tablespoons of toasted almonds, chopped, dill and parsley for the table. 2. Put the chicken in the pan and fry on all sides. This will take about 5-7 minutes. 3. In a separate bowl, mix the powders: turmeric, cinnamon, cardamom, salt and pepper, and put them in a pile on the chicken and onions, stir well. 4. Pour orange juice, broth, honey, tomato paste, mix well. Then, increase the fire and boil for about 2 minutes. Then turn the heat down and cook for about 45 minutes to an hour, or until the chicken is completely cooked. 5. Serve the stew hot with the dill and parsley. Meanwhile, peel the oranges, cut into pieces, and put them aside. 6. In a separate frying pan, roast the almonds on a slow fire until golden brown, but not burned. Remove from heat and let it cool. 7. When the chicken is cooked, add the oranges to the pan, and stir gently. Let simmer for another 5 minutes to let the taste come out. Add toasted almonds, chopped. 8. Serve the orange and orange peel stew with steamed rice or a loaf of fresh bread. The orange and orange peel stew is delicious and healthy.

The ingredients for this Sangria are: 2 cups grape juice, 1 cup orange juice, 1 cup pomegranate juice, 1 cup apple juice, 1 cup cranberry juice, 1 lemon, sliced, 1 orange, sliced, 1 lime, sliced, 1 cup grapes, halved, 1 cup strawberries, sliced, 2 cups soda water, ice. Instructions: Add the sliced lemon, orange, and lime to the pitcher. Stir gently to mix the fruit in. Add the grapes and strawberries to the pitcher. Stir gently to mix the fruit in. Add the cranberry and apple juices. Stir gently to mix the juices in. Place the pitcher in the refrigerator for at least an hour, so the flavors meld. Add the soda water to the pitcher and stir gently to mix. Add ice to the pitcher and stir gently to mix the ice in. Then fill each glass with ice. Pour the non-alcoholic sangria over the ice. Serve immediately. Enjoy your refreshing Non-Alcoholic Sangria!

Title: Baked Beans —Durgin Park— 1. Half a pound of dried navy beans— 1 medium onion, chopped—— 1 tablespoon molasses—— 1/4 cup brown sugar—— 1 tablespoon ketchup—— 1 tablespoon mustard—— 1 teaspoon salt—— 1/2 tsp. black pepper—— 14 tsp. ground cloves———————————————————— 4 cups of water——————dish or croutons, to taste,———1 pound bacon, chopped in small pieces — — 8 quarts water——6 quarts Beans— ——— Soak overnight or for at least 8 hours. Then drain. 2. Preheat oven to three hundred and twenty-five degrees. 3. Put the soaked beans, the chopped onion, the molasses, the brown sugar, the ketchup, the mustard, the salt, the pepper, the cloves, the cinnamon, the nutmeg, and the water into a large stewpan. Stir well to mix. 4. Add the chopped bacon to the pan, mixing them in with the beans. Cover with a lid, and bake in the preheated oven for four to five hours, or until the beans are tender and the liquid is reduced. 5. After two hours, check the beans to see if they’re simmering. If the liquid has reduced too much, add a little more water. 6. After four hours, if the beans are tender and the sauce is sufficiently reduced, remove the pan from the oven. 7 Let the beans cool slightly before serving. Serve Durgin Park Beans with grilled meats, cornbread, or croutons. Enjoy! Store leftover beans in the refrigerator in a covered container. Reheat them in the oven or on the stove.

And it was still very hard to swallow the two large, heavy cakes. I hoped that I had done well enough, but I knew I was putting on weight. I did not go to the kitchen to eat my puddings at the coffee-houses in the city, but went to a pot of milk and put on my coat, went into the house, ate a piece of lard, sat in a rocking chair. 2. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, ginger, cinnamon and cloves. Set aside. 3. In a large bowl, cream the softened butter and 1 cup of sugar until light and fluffy. This can be done with an electric hand mixer or with a wooden spoon. 4. Add the molasses, egg, sour cream, and vanilla, and beat well. 5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture and stir until just combined. Do not overmix. 6. Put the remaining 12 cup of sugar in a shallow dish. Then scoop the dough into 1-inch balls. Coat each ball with the granulated sugar. Then place on the prepared baking sheet, about 2 inches apart. 7. Bake for 10-12 minutes, until the edges begin to set and the tops begin to crack. 8. Remove from the oven and let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for several minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely. 9. Repeat with the remaining dough. 10. When the cookies are completely cooled, store them in an airtight container at room temperature. They will keep for about a week.

Having melted the butter, take it out of the oven, and pour it into the bottom of a saucepan. In a separate bowl, beat the buttermilk with the eggs and four tablespoons of butter. Add the liquid ingredients to the dry ones and mix lightly. Pour the batter into the hot saucepan. Bake for twenty minutes, until a skewer inserted into the middle of the cake comes out clean. Remove from the oven, brush with the remaining butter.

A chicken liver paste on toast, flavored with aniseed and garlic. For half a loaf of rye, 12 cup butter, 14 cup olive oil, 1 pound chicken livers, 14 cup chopped onion, 2 tablespoons aniseed, 12 teaspoon salt, 14 teaspoon pepper. Instructions: The butter and oil mix in a little dish. Butter one side of each slice of bread. Then, in a baking tray, put the bread, unbuttered side up. Bake for five minutes, or until the bread is brown and crisp. Into a small saucepan, heat the remaining oil. Add the chicken livers, the onion, the salt and pepper, and cook for five minutes, or until the chicken livers are cooked. Add the aniseed, and cook for one minute. Then, with a fork, mash the chicken livers and onion until they form a paste. Then, take the bread out of the oven, and cover it with the chicken liver paste. Then put the bread back in the oven, and bake for another five minutes. Rub the bread with the garlic halves. Serve hot.

Then the hen jumped up, ate a fig, took a sip of coffee, and ascended the staircase to the pan to the petty bourgeois, and said to the woman, "Come in, and we'll bake a cake for you." Her pan had a little oven in it, and the woman immediately said: “Oh, I do cakes too, Madame; that is why we are so cheap. But you don't know how to make cakes. And I don't know how to make cakes; what do you do if you haven't any butter?" And she got out a big pan and put butter and cheese in it, and beat them together, a lump of butter in a lump of cream cheese. Add the eggs and the vanilla, and beat them a little. Add the sugar, and beat them a little. Add the flour, and stir it in. Add the chocolate and the nuts, and stir it in. Add the milk and stir it in. Then bake for forty-five minutes, until the crumbs stick to the bottom. Let it cool in the pan until it is quite cold. Bring a small saucepan of water to the boil, then reduce heat and stir in chocolate until melted and smooth. Pour chocolate over cooled cheesecake and let stand thirty minutes. Refrigerate for three hours, until set. Then the cake was cut up and thrown on the table for the poor peasants to see. Here is the summary of the directions: Add the chocolate and the nuts. Beat the cream cheese and butter, and add the eggs and the vanilla. Add the sugar. Add the flour and stir it in. Add the milk and stir it in. Pour the dough into the pan, and bake it. Pour the chocolate over it and bake it, and it should be a very beautiful cream. Pour the chocolate over the cake and let it cool. Then put it in the refrigerator for three hours. This recipe contains the ingredient list, the instructions, and the summary of a mint chocolate cheesecake, and is classified by our document-classifier.

The ingredients are: 12 cup butter, softened 2 cups of sugar 2 tbsp lemon extract 4 eggs 3 cups of flour 1 teaspoon baking powder a pinch of salt 1 12 cups milk. Preheat the oven to 350°F. Put the butter and sugar in a large bowl. Add the eggs and lemon extract. Put the flour, baking powder, and salt in a separate bowl. Add the flour alternately with the milk to the butter mixture. Beat until just combined. Pour into the greased cake pan. Bake for about 30 minutes or until a cake skewer comes out clean. Let cool before serving.

The crepes: 1 cup buckwheat flour * 1 tsp. baking powder * a pinch of salt * 2 eggs * 1 and a half cups milk * 2 tablespoons melted butter * 1 tsp. vanilla * For the stuffing: 4 slices bacon, diced; 1 duck breast, skinned, shredded; 2 Granny Smith apples, peeled, cored and chopped; 2 shallots, chopped; 2 tablespoons butter, 12 cup of chicken broth; a tablespoon of thyme For the Chartreuse cream: 1 cup whipped cream * 12 cup chicken broth * 2 tablespoons green Chartreuse * 1 teaspoon vanilla. 1. Pour the wet into the dry and mix it. Refrigerate for half an hour. 2. For the stuffing, cook the bacon in a large frying pan over low heat until it is golden and crunchy. Drain the bacon with a slotted spoon and keep it aside. Dry the duck breast with a piece of paper. Season it with salt and pepper and brown it in the bacon fat. 3. Add the shallots and cook for two minutes. Then add the apples and cook them for a few minutes until they are soft. 4. Add the bacon and the duck to the pan and stir. Add the butter and broth and bring to a boil. Then reduce the heat and simmer for five minutes. 5. Add the thyme and season to taste with salt and pepper. 6. For the Chartreuse cream, bring the cream, broth, green Chartreuse and vanilla to a boil in a saucepan. Simmer it for about five minutes. 7. To serve, put one of the crepes on the counter and put on it two to three tablespoons of the stuffing. Roll it up and place it on a dish. Pour the Chartreuse cream over it and serve at once. Enjoy this recipe! Do you have any questions about it?

Instructions: Soak the beans overnight in plenty of water to shorten the cooking time and improve digestion, or omit this step if soaking is not necessary. 2. Wash the beans and put them into a large pan. Cover with stock, bring to the boil, and simmer until tender but not mushy, about 1-1/2 hours. Depending on the age of the beans, the cooking time may vary. 3. While the beans are cooking, fry the bacon in a large frying pan until crisp. Remove the bacon with a slotted spoon and keep it aside. 4. To the bacon fat, add the onions and fry over a moderate heat for about 5 minutes. Add the ham and cook until the ham is hot and well heated, about 10 minutes. 5. When the beans are tender, drain and reserve the cooking liquor. In a large stewpan, mix the beans with the ham and onions, bacon, tomato paste, brown sugar, worcestershire sauce, mustard, salt, and pepper. Add 1 cup of the reserved cooking liquor and stir well. Add more stock if necessary. 6. Cover and bake in a preheated moderate oven for 4-1/2 to 4-1/2 hours or until the beans are very tender. Every hour, check the beans and add more stock if they look dry. 7. Serve the beans with chopped parsley if desired.

Present – A half-pound of party bread, or other thin-sliced bread; a half-cup butter, at room temperature; two tablespoons milk; one large egg; a tablespoon sugar; one-half teaspoon vanilla; and two tablespoons of aniseed coffee. In a small bowl, beat together the butter, milk, egg, sugar, vanilla, and anise coffee. Spread the bread on the buttered baking dish and soak with the butter and egg mixture. Cook for ten minutes or until golden brown. Let stand for five minutes before serving.

Inventive and tasteful, this cake tastes of lemon cream. The recipe is: For the cake: 1 cup of fine flour – 1 cup of caster sugar, plus 1 tablespoon for rolling it in – 2 teaspoons of baking powder – 1 teaspoon of baking soda – 14 teaspoon salt – 1 cup sour cream or Greek yoghurt – 3 tablespoons melted butter – 2 eggs – 2 teaspoons of grated lemon rind – 2 tsp milk – 3 tablespoons sour cream. 2. In a medium bowl, beat the flour, 1 cup of sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt. 3. In another bowl, beat the sour cream or Greek yoghourt, the melted butter, the eggs and the lemon rind. 4. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ones and stir just enough to mix the whole thing. 5. Divide the mixture into twenty two-cm balls, roll them in the remaining sugar. 6. Place the balls on the oiled baking sheet, a little apart. 7. Bake for 10-12 minutes, until the edges are golden. Let the cakes cool on a wire rack for five minutes. 8. In the meantime, mix in a small bowl the icing sugar and the lemon juice to make the glaze. 9. Dip the top of each cake in the glaze and let the excess drip. Then put the cakes back on the wire rack to let the glaze set. 10. Serve and enjoy!

SUMMARY OF RECIPE For Lemon-Cake: 1. 1. Measure out the following ingredients: — 1 12 cups flour, 1 12 teaspoons baking powder, 14 teaspoon salt, 1 stick butter, softened. — 2 cups sugar, 3 eggs, 12 cup milk, 1 teaspoon vanilla, 1 tablespoon grated lemon-rind, 12 cup lemon juice. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour one 9x13-inch cake pan. 2. In a medium bowl combine flour, baking powder, and salt. Set aside. 3. Butter and sugar in a large bowl cream together until light and fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add vanilla. 4. 5. In a small bowl, combine milk, lemon rind, and lemon juice. Add to creamed mixture. 6. Add milk mixture alternately with flour mixture. Beat on medium speed until well mixed. 7. Pour into prepared cake pan. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan on wire rack for 10 minutes.

‘Laal Maas’ consists of lamb, garlic, ginger, onion, tomato and spices. The following recipe is taken from a traditional Sindhi recipe. For the marinade: 2 and a half pounds of lamb, boned and cut into one-inch cubes, a half cup of plain yogurt, one and a half tablespoons of minced garlic, one and a half tablespoons of minced ginger (or finely grated), one and a half tablespoons of grated ginger, a quarter of a cup of yoghurt, one and a half tablespoons of salt, one and a half ounces of mustard seeds, half a tsp of nutmeg, half a tsp of cardamom, half a tsp of mace, half a tsp of mace, half a tsp of cloves, half a tsp of nutmeg, half a tsp of azure powder, half a tsp of red chilli powder, a half cup of water, a cup of thick cream, a half cup of whipped cream and a half cup of chopped coriander leaves to garnish. *Combine the ingredients in a bowl, cover and refrigerate for at least four hours, preferably overnight. In a frying pan, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the lamb in batches of two or three so that it does not crowd the pan. Brown for about three minutes.

Instructions: Stuff an acorn squash with the marinade and put it in a baking dish. It is possible to replace the potatoes with canned, roasted or boiled beans or lentils (these are not necessary for flavoring), but they will be hard to find. This dish can be a good source of vegetables and protein for the Thanksgiving feast. Add peppers and beans, pour wine (optional) on top. Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.
Garlic-baked vegetables with spoon bread. Here are the ingredients: 1lb. of baby bellas, 1lb. of baby bellas, 1lb. of baby bellas, 1lb. of baby bellas.

The recipe was very simple and the ingredients were not hard to find. One cup butter, one cup sugar, one cup flour, one teaspoon vanilla, one cup marshmallows, one cup powdered sugar, one and a half cups milk, one and a half tablespoons peppermint extract, one cup powdered sugar, half a cup milk, one-half cup powdered sugar, and one-half teaspoon salt. One cup of marshmallows. One cup of melted marshmallows. One cup of powdered sugar. One and a half cups of milk. One and a half tablespoons of peppermint extract. One cup of chopped nuts. One cup of melted marshmallows. One-half cup of milk. One-half cup of chopped nuts. One-half cup of peppermint extract. One-half cup of chopped pecans. One-half cup of milk. One-half cup of peppermint extract. One-half cup of chopped pecans. One-half cup of chopped nuts. One-half cup of milk. One-half cup of peppermint extract. The recipe calls for one-half cup of chopped pecans. One-half cup of milk. One-half cup of peppermint extract. The recipe calls for one-half cup of milk. The recipe calls for one-half cup of chopped nuts. The recipe calls for one-half cup of peppermint extract.

It is the Yam and Bean Curd dish. Put the water in a pot, add salt, sugar, a little soy sauce, a little sugar, a little soy sauce, then add the sweet corn, and boil it until it's soft, but not mushy, for about 5 minutes. Drain and put on a plate lined with paper towels. Then put the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil in the pan and fry it quickly with a little dried chili, a little salt, a little garlic, and then fry a small amount of yam. Add a little dried chili, then fry the onions and garlic for three to four minutes, add a little, and stir-fry for thirty seconds, add the yam and stir-fry for ten minutes until the yam turns golden brown. Transfer to a dish and serve.

12 pint of dry white wine (I use Chardonnay) 3 tablespoons of olive oil 4 cloves of garlic chopped 2 pounds of squid drained and cut into dice 12 pint of shrimps deveined and peeled 1 quart of water 2 bay leaves salt to taste 14 ounce pepper 18 teaspoon black pepper 1/8 teaspoon nutmeg 1/8 teaspoon cinnamon 1/8 teaspoon ground ginger 1/8 teaspoon ground allspice 1/8 teaspoon ground cardamom 1/8 teaspoon mace 1/8 teaspoon pepper salt 1/8 nutmeg. 1/8 teaspoon cinnamon 1/8 teaspoon ground ginger 1/8 nutmeg 1/8 teaspoon cloves. 1/8 teaspoon cardamom. / 8 thyme leaves, 2 bay leaves, 2 thyme leaves, 2 thyme leaves, 2 thyme leaves, 2 thyme leaves, / 4 thyme leaves, / 1 nutmeg. / 8th teaspoon cinnamon, 1/8th teaspoon ground ginger, / 8th teaspoon nutmeg. / 8th teaspoon thyme leaves, 2 thyme leaves, 2 thyme leaves, / 8th teaspoons. / 8th teaspoons. / 8th teaspoon thyme leaves, / 8th teaspoons. chopped thyme leaves, / 2nd thorny leaves, / 8thumbs. / drained clams. / added a pinch of salt. / Add a pinch of pepper. / Added 1/8ths. Salt to taste. / Add 3 tablespoons of vegetable broth to the ingredients. Stir well and serve in a large soup bowl.

To be made with: 1 pound of dried peas; 1 lb of salt pork, cut into dice; 1 onion, cut into cubes; 1 cup of molasses; 1 cup of brown sugar; 1 tbsp of dry mustard; 1 tsp salt; 1 tsp black pepper; 1 cup ketchup. Preheat the oven to 300 ° F. Wash the peas well and put them in a large saucepan. 3. Add the pork, onion, molasses, brown sugar, dry mustard, salt and pepper. 4. Add ketchup on top. 5. Bake for 6 hours until peas are tender.

Instructions: 1 cup sugar 12 tsp. anise extract 2 tbsp. baking powder 1 cup all-purpose flour 1 tbsp. milk 1 egg 1 tbsp. aniseeds. 2. In a medium bowl, cream together the butter, sugar, anise extract, and baking powder. 3. Add the flour and milk, and mix until smooth. 4. In a small bowl, mix the egg and aniseeds. 5. Drop by tablespoonfuls onto the buns, stirring after each. 6. On a floured board, roll out the dough to 14-inch thickness. Cut into desired shapes and place on baking sheet. 7. Bake for 8 minutes or until golden.

Prepare as follows: Ingredients: 1 cup of stout beer. 1 cup of unsalted butter. 34 cup unsweetened cocoa. 2 cups of sugar. 2 eggs. 1 tablespoon vanilla extract. 1 cup of flour. 1 teaspoon baking soda. 1. In a small saucepan, heat the stout and butter on low heat until butter melts. Remove from heat and stir in cocoa powder until smooth. 2. In a large bowl, combine the sugar, eggs, and vanilla. Pour the chocolate into the eggs and sugar. 3. Sift the flour and baking soda and add to the chocolate mixture, stirring until well blended. 4. Pour into the greased pan. Bake at 325° for 30 minutes. Cool before serving.

The loaf was made from the following: 1 cup (2 sticks) butter, softened, 2 cups of sugar, 4 eggs, 12 cup grated rind of lemon, 3 cups of plain flour, 1 teaspoon of baking powder, 1 teaspoon of salt, 12 cup buttermilk, and 12 cup lemon juice. 2. Cream the butter and sugar in an electric mixing bowl, then add the eggs one at a time, then the lemon rind. 3. In another bowl, mix the flour, soda, baking powder, and salt. 4. In another bowl, mix the lemon juice, buttermilk, and vanilla. 5. Add the flour mixture and the buttermilk mixture alternately to the butter and egg, starting and ending with the flour. Add the mix to the oiled pan. 5. Bake the cake for 50 to 60 minutes or until a skewer comes out clean when inserted in the center. Let it cool for ten minutes. Turn it over on a plate. Serve at room temperature.

The method of preparation is as follows: Grind together the cumin, mustard, fenugreek, turmeric, coriander, cumin, and ginger in a spice grinder. Set aside. 1 tablespoon olive oil 2 onions chopped 3 cloves garlic chopped 12 teaspoon ground cloves 12 teaspoon ground cinnamon 14 teaspoon ground allspice 2 teaspoons ginger powder 2 lbs. lean boneless lamb cut into small pieces 1 cup water 1 tin of tamarind paste 6 ounces chutney 1 tablespoon honey 1 tablespoon white vinegar 1 tablespoon lemon juice chopped fresh parsley leaves and shredded 34 cups chopped dill, chopped fine, and set aside. 1. Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. 2. Add the onions and garlic, cook for 3 minutes, stirring. 3. Add the lamb, stir and cook until brown. 4. Add the spices, stir and cook for 1 minute. 5. Add the water, tomato paste, honey, vinegar, lemon juice, parsley, dill, and tamarind. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until lamb is very tender, about 2 hours.

It contains one cup of lentils, one cup of rice, two onions, three cloves of garlic, four cups of water, one tablespoon of olive oil, one teaspoon of cumin, one teaspoon of salt, one-half teaspoon of pepper, and some fresh parsley for garnish. It is prepared as follows: Peel and cut the onions into thin slices. Place them in a stew-pan. Stir them occasionally and let them simmer till they become very soft and are reduced in bulk, this should take about twenty or thirty minutes. Be patient for this operation is essential to the flavour of the soup. While the onions are cooking, wash the rice in cold water till the water runs clear. Set aside half the cooked onions for a garnish. Put the mashed garlic into the pan with the remaining onions, and let it cook till it begins to give out its odour, then add the rice. Stir all this thoroughly. Now put in the lentils, the cumin, salt and pepper, and then add the water. Add a little salt and pepper to taste. When the water is boiling hard, cover the pan and let it simmer for twenty minutes or until the rice is cooked and the lentils are tender. When the rice and lentils are cooked, fluff them up with a fork, and if necessary add more salt or pepper. Serve hot with a garnish of the cooked onions and the parsley.

Then the recipe: 1 and a half cups of self-rising flour – 1 and a half cups of white sugar – 1 and a half cups cocoa powder – 1 and a half teaspoons baking powder – 1 and a half teaspoons baking soda – 12 teaspoon salt – 2 large eggs at room temperature – 1 and a half cups whole milk – 1 and a half cups vegetable oil – 2 teaspoons vanilla essence – 1 and a half cups boiling water – 1 and a half cups chocolate chips For the chocolate sauce: – 1 cup of double cream – 1 and a half cups chocolate chips For the cake: – In a large bowl, mix the self-rising flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda and salt. – Add the eggs one at a time and beat them. – Make a well in the middle and add the milk, oil and vanilla. – Stir until you get a smooth and even batter. – Add the boiling water and stir until you get a smooth and even batter again. The batter will be a little thin, but it’s okay. – Add the chocolate chips and stir. – Pour the batter into the prepared springform pan. Cover with aluminium foil. – Pour half a liter of water in the bottom of the pressure cooker. – Make a sling of aluminium foil and place it under the springform pan, so that you can remove it more easily after baking. – Bake on high pressure for 35 minutes. Then add the sling and lower the springform pan into the pressure cooker. Close the lid and put the valve in the sealing position. Set the timer to 50 minutes. – Bake on high pressure for 35 minutes. – When the timer goes off, let the pressure release naturally for about 15 minutes. – After 15 minutes, carefully release the remaining pressure. – With the help of the sling, carefully lift the springform pan out of the pressure cooker. Take off the aluminium foil and let the cake cool down completely. – For the chocolate sauce: In a small saucepan, heat the double cream over medium heat until it starts steaming. Do not boil. – Remove from the heat and add the chocolate chips. Let sit for 30 seconds and then stir until they are melted. – Pour over the cake. Stir the cream and chocolate together until it’s a smooth and shiny ganache.

The recipe is as follows: a pound of Italian sausage, removed from the intestine; two onions, sliced thin; two cloves of garlic, minced; two tablespoons of butter; one tablespoon of oil; a teaspoon of salt; a half of a pepper; a half of a thyme; one cup of chicken broth; a large loaf of dry bread, cut into 1-inch cubes, or about 10 cups; two beaten eggs; a quarter of a cup of chopped parsley. In a frying pan over a moderate fire, cook the sausage, breaking it into small pieces, until well browned and cooked. Remove the sausage with a slotted spoon and keep it warm. In the same frying pan put the butter and oil. When the butter has melted, put in the sliced onions. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the onions are golden, about twenty minutes. Then put in the garlic, salt, pepper, thyme and sage. Then cook for two minutes. Pour in the broth, stir it and scrape the bottom of the frying pan. Now in a large mixing bowl, combine the cubed bread, cooked sausage, golden onion sauce, beaten eggs and chopped parsley. Toss the mixture well and put it in the buttered baking dish. Cover with aluminum foil. Bake at 350 degrees for thirty minutes. Then remove the foil and bake for another fifteen to twenty minutes, until the top is golden and crunchy. Let the stuffing stand a few minutes before serving. Enjoy your sausage and golden onion dressing. (Note: This dressing is excellent for a holiday dinner or for a thanksgiving dinner.) Also, if you wish, you can stuff it inside a turkey.

The ingredients:—One salmon fillet—half a crab—Half a cupful of breadcrumbs—One-fourth cupful of mayonnaise—One egg—One tablespoonful of mustard—One-half tablespoonful of lemon juice—One-half teaspoonful of Worchestire sauce— One-half teaspoonful of salt— A quarter of a teaspoonful of pepper— A quarter of a cupful of olive oil——And the directions:—I. Put the salmon on a pan, and bake it for ten to fifteen minutes. Let it cool, then flake it into small pieces. II. In a large bowl, mix together the flakes of salmon, the crab, the breadcrumbs, the mayonnaise, the egg, the mustard, the lemon juice, the Worchestire sauce, the salt, the pepper, the parsley, and the chives. IV. Let the mixture stand until it thickens. III. Make eight equal patties. Fifteen drops of oil in a frying pan. V. Season each cake with a little salt. Add the cakes, and fry them about four minutes on each side. VI. Put the salmon and crab cakes on a dish. Serve them warm, with lemon.

(flour and two eggs) – Salt and pepper to taste – 1 teaspoon dried basil – 1 teaspoon dried oregano – the shells. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Cook the jumbo pasta shells according to the manufacturer's instructions. During the cooking of the pasta, heat a frying pan over medium heat. Drain and set aside. Stir in the spinach and garlic and cook for 2 or 3 minutes. Add the cooked spinach to the ricotta and shredded chicken. Add the grated Parmesan, eggs, salt and pepper and mix until well blended. Let cool. Pour a cup of sauce into a 9x13-inch casserole. Stuff each shell with a large spoonful of the chicken and ricotta mixture and arrange them, seam side down, in the baking dish. Add the remaining sauce and spread it out over the stuffed shells. Cover with aluminum foil and bake for about 20 minutes. Then sprinkle with the grated mozzarella. Cover and bake for another 30 minutes. Then remove the foil and bake for another 10 to 15 minutes until the cheese is golden and bubbling. Let the shells rest for a few minutes before serving. Then garnish with more grated Parmesan cheese or fresh basil leaves. Serves 6 to 8 people. Enjoy this rich and tasty meal.

I’ll be happy to! Here’s a simple recipe for Johnny-cakes with blackberries: 2 cups of self-raising flour * 1 cup of sugar * 1 tablespoon baking powder * 14 teaspoon salt * 2 tablespoons melted butter * 12 cup milk * 1 egg beaten * 12 cup milk * 12 cup blackberries * 2 cups confectioner’s sugar – to dust the top of the cake. * 1 sheet of baking-paper * 2 tablespoons of sugar * 1 teaspoon baking-powder * 12 teaspoon salt * 1 cup blackberries * 12 cup blackberries * 12 cup sour cream * 12 cup icing sugar * Add the cold butter, and with a wooden spoon or your fingertips rub it into the dry ingredients until you have a coarse meal. Add the milk, and mix until the mixture forms a soft dough. Then tip it on to a lightly floured surface and knead gently until smooth and elastic. Roll out to a thickness of a quarter of an inch. * Cut out rounds with a glass or a cookie cutter. When you’ve used up all the dough, gather the scraps, knead them together and roll them out again. * Put the rounds on the baking-sheet, and brush the tops with a little honey or maple syrup. * Bake the cakes for about 15 minutes, until golden brown and cooked through. They should be light and fluffy. While the cakes are baking, prepare the blackberry topping: wash the blackberries, pick out any pips or stalks and allow them to thaw.

I have a savory stuffing made with Italian sausage. I put it in the body of a chicken. Preheat the oven to 375°. 2. In a large frying pan, heat the oil at medium heat, add the sliced onions and cook until they are browned, stirring occasionally. It will take about 20-25 minutes. 3. Turn off the heat and add the minced garlic. Add a little salt and pepper and stir for 1-2 minutes. 4. In a large bowl, combine the cooked onions and garlic with the sausage, thyme, sage, salt and pepper. Then mix well. 5. In a separate bowl, mix the broth, breadcrumbs and Parmesan cheese. Add this mixture to the sausage and onion mixture and stir until everything is evenly mixed. 6. Transfer the stuffing to a greased, rectangular baking dish. Then drizzle the melted butter over the stuffing. 7. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy on top. Serve hot with your favorite dishes. As the editor of The Salt, I was very interested in a recent article in Science about the biological basis of cooking, which I suppose is what makes people "enchilada casserole" in the first place. In this paper, two biologists at Columbia University, Marco Mattiacci and Silke Wandsnider, argue that people's desire to seek out tasty foods with a lot of sugar, salt, or fat is an old, deeply rooted human behavior. I'm sure you know people in a state of anxiety or exhaustion, stress, they often reach for snacks or candy, they don't have a choice. It wasn't until now that some scientists realized that our desire to look for energy food was deeply rooted in the emergence of our species. Apricot-Jam and Egg Rolls—Ingredients:—1 cup of finely-sifted flour—1 tablespoon sugar—2 tsp. baking powder—1 tsp. salt—1 tablespoon butter—crumbled cold—1 cup apricot jam—1 cup milk—1 egg—1 teaspoon vanilla—optional,—1/4 cup chopped walnuts. I have just re-watched The Wire and I really like it, but there is one scene that I just cannot stand. I know the intention of the series is to present the brutal reality of the Baltimore drug trade in the nastiest possible way, but this scene feels in the least realistic and is totally unnecessary. It just seems like a cheap attempt to shock the audience and bring the shock value to the series. Personally, I feel The Wire works best when it focuses on the complex characters, the intricate plots and the social issues that the series raises, but this scene is completely irrelevant and completely out of place. It is disappointing to see a series that is otherwise so good have a moment that doesn’t work for me.

I am a high-school student, and I am wondering if it would be useful to take a summer AP class to show off my college application. I have heard that colleges are looking for students who challenge themselves and take rigorous courses, and I am thinking of taking an AP class to show off my abilities, but I am worried about the load and whether I would be too tired in the summer. Have you ever taken an AP class outside of school in the summer? How did it affect your college application? I would appreciate any advice. Thank you!

I've been playing Team Fortress 2 for a while now, and I have to say, the new engineers are pretty cute. They look so clueless and innocent, it's hard not to be fond of them. It's like they're learning to build sentry guns and dispensers and it's a funny sight. All the new engineers have the new hats and tool belts, which is really sweet. I know they're not very good at it yet, but I can't help rooting for them.

I thought I would tell you the strangest thing that happened to me today. I have had, to tell the truth, the strangest experience of my life. I was walking down the street, when I noticed a crowd gather in a little park. Curious to know what it was, I went to look and to my astonishment found a group of street entertainers giving the most wonderful show I had ever seen. They were not ordinary street entertainers. They were dressed in the most wonderful costumes, and they had the most amazing talents. There was a fire-eater, a acrobat, a magician, even acrobats. The energy and excitement was quite palpable. I felt I had come upon a real magic trick. I stood there spellbound by their skills, which seemed to defy the laws of nature. Then it was as if time had stood still and I had been transported into a different world. The audience was cheering and clapping, so enthusiastic were they. I joined in with them, unable to resist the sheer delight of it. It was a moment of pure joy and amazement, and I shall never forget it. Afterwards I spoke to some of the performers. They were so modest and so devoted to their profession. They told me about their travels and the difficulties they had to overcome as street performers. It was inspiring to see how much they loved what they did. As I left the park, I felt as if I had experienced the greatness of art and the capacity it has to unite people. I wanted to share it with you all, because it was such an unforgettable experience. I hope you all stop and enjoy any street performers you may come across. You never know what magic you may witness. Be curious and keep on seeking those surreal moments. Here’s to them!

Among the ruins of the city, I have recently met a strange being which has made me both amazed and distressed. This being, unlike all the others I have met, seems to have exhausted its food, and it is a chilling reminder of the result of an unbridled consumption, which can be disastrous for our environment. This once formidable beast, still roaming the countryside, wanders and wanders without finding any food. Its once powerful and muscular frame has wasted away, leaving only a skeleton. Its eyes, once shining with a sharp predatory light, now show an intense emptiness. The monster's desperate movements plow the deserted landscape, slow and painful. A groan, a lamentable cry resounds in the empty places, a cry of hunger, of the nostalgia for something that no longer exists. As I watch this being, I cannot help thinking of the consequences of our actions. We too are capable of consuming without thinking of the consequences, of exhausting our natural resources, of destroying the balance of the environment. This monster is a warning that our actions have far-reaching consequences. It is a warning that if we do not change our ways, we too will find ourselves in a world without food. We must take responsibility for our actions and seek to find sustainable solutions before it is too late. In the suffering of this being, I am reminded of the importance of compassion and pity. We must not ignore the suffering of others, whether they are human beings or animals. It is our duty to protect and preserve the balance of the environment for the sake of all beings. I wish this monster to serve as a reminder of the consequences of our actions. I wish this monster to serve as a means of transformation, a tool to force us to rethink our priorities, to choose solutions which can ensure a better future for everyone.

The scene in The Wire in which the two cops, Detectives mcNulty and Moreland, repeating incessantly the word ‘damn’, is just awful and for me the worst part of the show. The characters are terrific and it was a stupid decision on the part of the writers to include it. When a show is as good as The Wire, silly decisions like this really do stick out and spoil the whole. Basically, the scene makes both characters look foolish and that’s a real pity.

I need advice. My mother died a few months ago. She was in perfect health, rode twenty miles a day, did yogic exercises, was very agile and very athletic. I found her lying face down in her office, presumably from a heart attack, and she was dead in a few minutes. There was no premonition, no heart trouble. It was a complete surprise to everyone because she was healthy as a horse. It has been very difficult for me, but I think the most difficult for my husband. He was very close to her and now he seems to be so lost, lost, and is probably very much hurt. He doesn't want to talk about it, he just lives. He says he is fine, but he is so emaciated. They were very close, he used to talk to her every night, he just came and looked at her for a few minutes. I do not know what to do for him. We have a little daughter, so we are very seldom alone. When we are alone, he just sits and looks at the air. I try to ask him about it, but he says he's fine. It breaks my heart. I know he is very much pained and I would like to heal him, but I do not know how. I am looking for advice on how to be there for him and help him. I know he does not want to talk about it yet, but when he wants to, I want to be able to help him. Any advice is very welcome. Thanks.

I’m twenty-two, and I’ve been living with my best friend since August. At first, I was just happy to live with one of my best friends. We’ve always been there for each other. I was studying for the MCATs, and he had a job far away, so we didn’t see each other much. But over time, I’ve come to care for him. I knew it was risky to live with someone you were fond of, but I never expected to feel this way. It’s been four months now. I’m crazy about him. Everything he does is so charming and adorable. Sometimes, when he laughs or when he’s cooking, I’m stricken with goose bumps. I can’t seem to help myself. I think about him all the time. I dream about him. My stomach turns every time he walks in the room or even looks at me. I like being in his presence. When he’s not here, I miss him terribly. Sometimes, I cry, because I miss him so much. When he comes back, I’m ecstatic, because I know he’s here. I love him and don’t want to be without him. I feel like I’m going to explode if I don’t tell him how I feel. But I’m afraid. I know he doesn’t feel the same way about me, and that I’m taking a huge risk in telling him. What if he starts feeling awkward living with me after I tell him? What if it destroys our friendship? I don’t know what to do. I’ve never felt this way about anyone before. I’ve always liked the idea of loving someone so much that it hurts, but I never thought I would actually feel this way.

I am twenty-three years old, I live at home with my parents, and I am terrified of death. I do not know what I am doing with my life, it is incomprehensible, and I regret everything. I know that it sounds as if I am overreacting, but this is what I feel twenty-four hours a day. I am so terrified of dying that I avoid everything that is even slightly dangerous. I do not go out at night because I am afraid of being robbed. And when I am at home I always check the locks on the doors and make sure that the windows are closed. I know that I must seek professional help, but I am terrified of going to a shrink. I have never talked to anyone about my feelings, and I am terrified at the thought of opening up to a stranger. I am afraid they will think I am crazy or they will judge me. I know I must take some action, but I do not know what to do. I am so terrified all the time, and I do not want to live like this any more. Please tell me what I must do. I cannot stand this feeling any longer.

Oh, yes: my family has talked about inside information they have received about terrorist attacks on major American cities, about nukes and about the corresponding government reaction. They have amassed enormous stockpiles of food and ammunition in case of economic collapse and have pressured me to do the same, inflicting deep wounds to my financial resources in the process. They have rehearsed doomsday scenarios in a way that overlaps absurd Qanon conspiracy theories, often with me present, in a completely serious tone. They have tried to get me to wear a headlamp around the clock for my “protection” and when I refused, they insisted I at least wear “magical” jewelry from a “magical” woman to protect me. When I refused that, too, they told me I was “on my own.” In short, my family has become radically paranoid and that has had a huge impact on my life. Thanks for your advice. This isn’t the first time they’ve done this sort of thing, but it is the first time it has affected me so much.

Well, here is a post without a title: The scene in The Wire where McNulty and Moreland just keep saying the word ‘fuck’ over and over again is dreadful. Watching it was terribly uncomfortable, and, I must say, I feel very awkward about it to this day. Though the scene might indicate the frustration and anger the two characters feel, I feel there are other ways of expressing anger without the use of such profanity. I consider this scene to be one of the most offensive parts of the entire series. What are your thoughts?

So I've been selling yogurt out of my garage to earn a few extra bucks. But the meth addict on the other side kept on complaining about the smell, so I went over to ask him to stop. When I got there, there was some guy in a suit talking to him. They both offered me some yogurt, telling me it was the best they'd ever had. The smell was a bit odd, but I took a bite and it made me really dizzy. I tried to talk, but it was all gibberish. I tried to walk home, but I felt so weak. The last thing I remember is the guy in the suit saying, "It's always the new pilots, isn't it?" They're always eating our product.

I would say: ‘ Go!’ There is nothing wrong in seeking help and talking openly with your parents, especially about something as important and personal as your mental health. Talking to those close to you about depression and anxiety may be difficult and scary, but by opening up, you’ll enable them to understand you better and they’ll be able to help and support you. Remember that your parents love you and want to help you, so try to be honest and open about your feelings and be open to what they can do to help.

People should not be allowed to have their lives ruined because of the abhorrent opinions of others. If you have enough background to be able to spoil the news that X won or Y said A, B, C, you are basically living in a coma, and that is your fault. And let no one say that people deserve to know the bad things their favorite politicians do. This is not a case where we talk about emotions, this is about people. Even if you don't agree with the emotions, forcing the truth on someone because you think they should know is disgusting and I hope you are proud of yourself. The irony and lack of self-awareness it takes to say: My God, spoilers! over literal facts and events is astonishing. It's like pressing Control-Alt-Delete and restarting your computer because Excel does not work as you want. Only this is reality, with real people and real consequences.

I have sometimes, when I have found something a bit hard to accept or understand, had the reaction of “Oh, it’s a woman,” or “It must be a difficult time for her,” or “Are you going to take my children away?” But here there is a more obvious implication: you don’t like women, and there’s nothing you can do about it. In the same way as a man, who was in a public place, is the focus of concern, the woman is the focus of concern. This is a long post, because you’ll only see it once, so if you want to skip to the comments here’s a link, and if you want to read on, here you are. The author points out that this “threat” is not a physical or tangible threat, but it is still a threat, in the sense that it is a threat to her, and in the sense that she did not have the option of not being threatened. It is worth reading the whole of the article, because the author was able to draw an interesting distinction. Here the attacker who thought the man was going to hurt the woman, did not take him away from her. She was not in charge of who was going to attack her. She was sexually assaulted. “If a man had got off the bus, gone up to her, punched her in the face and said he loved her, in that moment he would have assaulted her,” the author continued. The author then gave a very good example of how rape culture works: “The attacker was not just hurting me physically, like my attacker did, but he was also sexually assaulting me, just as he was assaulting me sexually by putting his peen into her,” just as he was assaulting her by trying to put his fingers between her breasts, just as he was assaulting her by making her ram her head against his penem.” Because she did not have the option of turning round (and probably even if she had, she wouldn’t have been able to), and because she did not have the option of whether and when or even whether she felt afraid, the attacker was able to exercise control over her.

Dear Reddit, I am deeply missing my mother, but I sometimes feel that she had already left me when she was still very young, and I’m not saying that she died. She simply stayed single and married some ghoul, who probably died at the age of twenty, and started a family with him. My siblings and I were born soon afterward—and in the course of events she was lost in history. She had a good job at the time as a saleswoman for another company. To add to this theme, I was pregnant during that time (my younger sister says it was just four months), and the doctors assured us that it would result in a child. I went along with my mother’s hope that I would have many siblings. Well, that wish came to nothing, because I had twins, born three weeks apart. When they did the ultrasound they saw two tiny legs in addition to the head, which had already been known for a while, but no one paid any attention to it until about seven weeks after conception. Well, after several abortions, the whole affair ended quickly when I discovered that my uterus had grown out of my pelvis, resulting in a double amputated baby. This added to the interest of the story. I was fairly short for my size, six foot, and two inches. While I was waiting for the surgery, there were some complications, so I had to go home for a while... needless to say, things weren’t going well. Then finally, about five weeks before the operation, one of their gynecologists, who had just finished with me, called me to his office. “Do you want to have the shot tonight?” he asked. Of course, as I had already been suffering for about six hours, I turned down his offer and took a few days off from work (because of money). The procedure took a little longer because of the complications, and my stomach is just now beginning to digest food, so I must watch my weight during the recovery. Fortunately, I had already eaten dinner earlier today, only a few scrambled eggs and meatloaf. So the first thing I feel is how aching I am. The pain feels like burning acid, and the next hour will be the most painful of my life. The doctor is probably expecting me soon; he’s probably waited long enough.

I need to say a few words about this scene from The Wire, mainly because I can't see why people praise it so much. For those who don't know, there is a scene in season 1 where Detectives McNulty and Bunk Moreland are investigating a crime scene, and they don't say a word, not a single word, except "stupid." I know it has been praised for demonstrating how effectively communication can take place, even with a single word. I even agree that the acting of Dominic West and Wendell Pierce is superb and that they are able to convey a range of emotions by their expressions and body language. But I find it boring to watch. It strikes me as lazy and a waste of creative talent, rather than as smart or clever. There is so much more they could have done with that scene. Dialogue is the great strength of The Wire, and the characters come alive through fragments of dialogue, filled with Baltimore slang. Cutting out all that language just detracted from the scene. It was also completely at odds with the realism that The Wire is often praised for. In real life, no matter how angry or frustrated they may be, professionals communicate much more effectively. The scene strikes me as an attempt to be memorable and original that fails, and comes across as forced and unrealistic. And finally, I worry that it could give a wrong impression of the series to newcomers. If someone were to skim through the episodes and came across this one, they might come to the wrong conclusion that The Wire is all about swearing and nothing else, which would be a grave error. In short, I found it a low point in an otherwise outstanding series, and I wanted to share my thoughts to see if others share my opinion. Although I'd also be interested to hear from those who think it's good, and why they like it.

“I have always had a great desire to adopt children. Since I was a young girl, whether I was single or in a relationship, I have always had a resolute view that there are so many children in the world who need love that I would prefer to adopt rather than have children of my own. My friends and family often tell me this is a very radical view. They tell me there is something natural, something innate, in wanting to have children from one’s own womb. They talk about the bond, about passing on one’s own genes, about seeing something of one’s own personality in the child. Some of them are even afraid of the difficulties of adopting, of having a child that is not one’s own. I understand their arguments, but I can’t shake off the desire, the need to adopt. Is this a crazy way of thinking? It may be unusual, but is it in any way unsound? There must be others who share this view. Adopted people, parents who have adopted, people who can give me their experiences. Please help me understand the different aspects of this view.” I would appreciate any views, experiences, insights you might be able to give me.

I know that there are a lot of people who think that the argument of the preparation time of Batman is a joke and an overstatement, but I'm here to argue that it's a good thing. First, let's acknowledge that Batman is a master crime fighter. He's been doing it for years, and he's had his fair share of both successes and failures. He knows what works and what doesn't, and he changes his strategy to keep one step ahead of his enemies. Now, as far as preparation time goes, Batman is meticulous. He plans everything in detail, from the weapons he carries, to the equipment he uses, to the routes he takes. He's not just throwing up his hands and hoping for the best. He's a tactician, and he knows that every second counts. But here's the thing: Batman's preparation time isn't just for him. It's for his allies as well. When he goes on a mission, he's not only thinking about his own safety and success, but also about the safety and success of his allies. He makes sure that his allies have the right equipment, the right training, and the right strategy to put out the bad guys. And let's not forget, it's not just about Batman fighting crime for the sake of fighting crime. He's fighting for justice, fighting for right, fighting to protect the weak and innocent from the people who are trying to harm them. By taking the time to prepare himself, he's not just saving his own skin. He's saving many lives. So the next time you hear that the argument of the preparation time of Batman is silly, just remember that it's not just about Batman. It's about his commitment to justice, his devotion to his allies, and his unwavering desire to protect the people of Gotham. Thanks for reading, redditors! Let me know what you think.

I am twenty years old and have suffered from anxiety for about two years, but it has become so bad that I can barely function anymore. At first it was only the feeling of a strange restlessness in the presence of people and in social situations, which was bad enough in itself, but then it grew into anxiety attacks, which sprang up at odd times during the day and now occur at almost any time. My heart beats so hard I feel I’m going to die, I get dizzy and giddy, and sometimes I even pass out. When that happens I start shaking and crying hysterically because I don’t know what else to do. This makes things ten times worse, not only because people look at you like a lunatic, but also because your body feels like it’s shutting down completely. After the attack I always think that I’ll never be able to recover, which only brings on another one. I’ve tried pills (Zoloft) and they don’t seem to help either; if anything, they make it worse, because I get more nervous knowing there’s something inside me that’s trying to calm me down. I’ve been to therapy, where I’ve been told all sorts of things, such as deep breathing exercises or meditation. But none of it works, because once the attack has hit me, there’s no stopping it, I have to let it run its course. I’ve lost friends because of this; nobody wants to be around someone who’s in a constant state of terror. And to tell the truth, I don’t want it either! But no matter what I do, I can’t seem to control these attacks, they take over completely and leave me powerless, waiting to see what’s going to happen next. Sometimes I wish I were dead so I wouldn’t have to go through this any longer. But then suicide may not be the answer either, considering how many other people suffer from similar problems. Either way, my life is awful right now...

After my mother’s death I felt that everything reminded me of her in some way, and it hurt to see or hear or even smell something that made me remember how much I missed her. Some months later I was frightened by something that really reminded me of her, but then I laughed and laughed and was able to go on with my life and be hurt by those small incidents no longer. I had just moved out of the house after a long time (my mother had died some six years before) and was living in a small apartment. My brother came to see me one day and we drove up to Arby’s to get some dinner. He had flown down the previous week knowing that it was very important for me to have an easy meal and not have to eat out every time. So we drew up outside Arby’s, which had been there ever since I left home, and I nearly went out of my mind. As soon as the cars honked, waiting for us to move forward, I realized what they could see through the windows. They looked exactly like the old people’s cars parked outside restaurants when their families aren’t there. The cars were backed up, bumper to bumper, and my car was blocking the two plates, just as though it wasn’t important that people be given a place to park without blocking it for anyone else.... And worst of all, I could only leave them and go home together, as I could not drive home before then.

After having looked at the map and revisited the subreddit, I have come to the following conclusion about the second floor plan. As I said, the city map was released over a week ago. As I have mentioned, the city map is a ‘solved’ part of the puzzle, meaning that it has no hidden clues. Therefore, the information required to solve the remaining parts of the puzzle must be in the book or the map which has already been released. To solve anything else, we need to be able to pinpoint a certain location. What makes this particularly difficult is that there is no hint that the locations on the map are at all relevant. A ‘location’ is a very broad concept; it could mean ‘anywhere in the universe’, or it could be something more specific, such as ‘somewhere in the city’. To make it easier to see what is going on, I have drawn up a little map below: Red dots: locations mentioned in Chapter 1 (extract from the book) Red X: locations mentioned in Chapter 2 (extract from the book) Orange line: where a ship is leaving. I have also drafted a draft of the floor plan, which I have annotated with a ruler. Please note that the scale of the floor plan is approximately the same as that of the city map. This is important. Also note that the length of the top-left arrow corresponds exactly to the length of the orange line. This is important too. This is where I have drawn a line from the arrow to the orange line. Then, at the intersection, I have drawn a second line. I think the arrow is the key to solving the final riddle.

The commonest question that the parents of autistic children are faced with is: How to talk to the autistic child? First, it is important to remember that every autistic individual is unique, so there is no such thing as a universally applicable answer. But there are some tips that could be helpful for many families. One is to be patient with the autistic child. It may take them a little longer to understand and respond to social cues and questions, and they need the time to do that. Another way to communicate with autistic children is to use pictures and symbols to help them understand what is being said. Another important way to communicate with the child is to use clear and unambiguous language. Do not use complicated or indirect language, which confuses them. Instead, use short and simple sentences that avoid ambiguity. In the final analysis, it is important to try and engage the child in the conversation as much as possible. Ask them questions, let them ask you questions and make the conversation as interesting and interactive as possible. By doing this, you are building the child’s confidence and communication skills.

The Gemini lunar heat shield is essential to the Artemis project, whose aim is to restore the landings on the Moon to 2024. But the recent images of the Orion spacecraft’s trial flight with a man-crewed version have caused considerable concern about the integrity of the heat shield. Some have pointed out that it seems to have suffered a number of punctures, which they think are due to a crease. Although it is difficult to make a definite assessment without more information, this observation has led many to ask whether the heat shield is damaged. Officially, NASA has not made any statement on the state of the heat shield, but has announced that it is closely following the situation and tries to gather more information. In the meantime, experts have indicated that any damage may not be of such a catastrophic nature if it can be repaired before any future mission. Others, however, fear that even a slight deterioration in the heat shield’s performance could compromise the safety of future missions and put the lives of the crewmen at risk. So it is not yet clear whether the Gemini lunar heat shield is damaged and how it will affect the plans of the project to restore landings on the Moon.

If you were given £20,000 to invest, how would you do it? There are so many possibilities that it is difficult to decide. Among the favourites are stocks, bonds, real estate, and cryptocurrencies. Stocks have a long history of giving high returns, but they are also quite volatile over the short term, that is, their price fluctuates quickly, which is risky. Bonds are generally considered safer than stocks because they yield a more certain income, the coupon. But the coupon is usually lower than the dividend on stocks. Real estate, which can yield income as well as capital, can be very attractive, but it usually requires a significant initial investment and requires a lot of work to manage. Cryptocurrencies are a relatively new asset class, and it is difficult to predict how they will develop over the long term. Some investors have made a lot of money from cryptocurrencies, but they are highly volatile and their price fluctuates quickly. In the end, the best investment will depend on your personal financial goals and tolerance for risk. You may wish to spread your investment over several asset classes to spread the risk and increase the opportunity.

"Please, give up! I won't change! Why am I here?—No, give up!" he repeated. "I don't know. To help you? To make a difference?—To help you?" To change the course of social history? " No! I'm here to be a nuisance. A noisy, arrogant, pompous pest that won't do anything because I'm convinced the world's rotten to the core. The world's rotten and I don't want you to be happy or satisfied or even content. I want you to be miserable and angry and disgusted!" He sprang up, ready to fight. "I want you to take pills, be a drug addict, feel rotten and put the blame on the government for what you've done to yourself. I want you to feel rotten, but to be quiet about it." "I want you to drown yourself in depression and self-destructive habits, instead of taking responsibility for your unhappiness. I don't want you to know that you're the reason you're unhappy, and you can make the world a better place for yourself by changing the way you see and deal with it. In short, I want you to be unsatisfied and miserable and unhappy." "I want you to go to hell and not know you're going there. Because a miserable world full of people who don't want to help each other means that for every million people, there are a million problems to be solved." So, if you want to be miserable, unhappy and not help yourself or others, that's fine with me. You're helping me make money. But that might just be a side-effect of my actions, not my primary purpose, so I have another reason for being here. I'm here to be a martyr. An arrogant, smug, sanctimonious, self-righteous, self-important martyr who refuses to do anything about the world's rotten core, because it's rotten, so I'm just going to sit here in my chair, write these worthless articles, and whine." And so it was that on the morning of May 26, I was run over by a man who was not watching where he was going. I was taken to three different hospitals in Baguio for an examination, then we decided to fly back to Metro Manila. There, I had an MRI, which revealed two fractured skulls, concussion and subdural hematoma—an accumulation of fluid in the brain due to bleeding inside or outside the skull—and brain contusion. After taking a week off from work, a period of recuperation of ten months, followed by physical therapy exercises and speech therapy, I finally finished a second round of rehabilitation recently, but didn’t recover at all. And whenever I’m asked how I feel now, my standard answer is ‘I’m recovering,’ but I know I’m not really well yet, and it’s the truth. The brain damage affects the frontal lobe and the parietal lobe. I am very forgetful, even after a year. How do you explain such a thing happening to someone? Do you know of any similar case? Read the whole thread, if you’re interested. Thank you, and see you.

I've been on the fence about this game, mostly because I don't know the universe, but it seems to have a lot of potential. I was hoping for some comments from someone who had already played it. The game will be available on Steam 27/8 (Early Access) and probably also on consoles in the second half of the year or maybe at the beginning of 2023. Does it have a lot of story? I'm not so fond of MMOs, but if it's really a single-player game, that's fine. Why do you not like MMOs? I never saw them as similar to Diablo, which I adore. To me, the best part of these games is exploring the worlds they create and getting to know the history and lore, and how you influence the worlds. And also with loot system. I haven't played many games with loot, but that was something I really enjoyed. I wanted to progress and get better equipment and then be able to look at all the beautiful things I had collected, all unique and interesting, you know what I mean? As with the Diablo games and Runescape, those are the MMOs I like. There were so many possibilities. In Elysium you play as a human who is both magician and soldier. You could be a gunslinger, a wizard, a magician or whatever you wanted. I was a magician / gunslinger. I do not remember the details of why, but I could use swords, longswords, axes and polearms at the same time. There was a lot of character design. I do not remember many details about the story or the gameplay, but the open world was really good. I loved to explore the world. You could walk for hours and suddenly find out cities, ruins and other things to discover. I also got into a big battle, which was a little strange because I did not look for combat then. I really liked character creation and customization. I was a long-ranger who did great damage. I'm a bit excited.

I have noticed that lately, every time I listen to my favorite playlists on Spotify, the commercials seem to get more and more annoying. It's like they want to force me to pay for the premium service just to get rid of them! Is it possible that Spotify is deliberately choosing such terribly irritating commercials? Or am I just being overly suspicious? But in any case, something needs to be done about this, or I'm going to lose my mind.

I made the mistake of thinking I could get away without reinstalling the air valve on my car after cleaning it, and ended up smearing oil all over my garage, staining the floor. I was a tyrant for having been lazy and missing an important step in the installation.

I have been anorexic and I have fought a terrible battle, but that does not give me the right to scold someone else for eating well. It is important to support and cheer each other up, even if our sufferings are different. We should be positive and support each other instead of criticizing and judging.

I have been fishing for a long time, but I have never been able to master the art of spooling the line. My friends tease me about it and make jokes about it. Besides, I usually lost my hooks and weights as well, which amused them more. I felt sad. But I was determined to master the technique and finally keep up with them.

'The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo' is a dark and exciting story that will keep you sitting at the edge of your seat. Based on Stieg Larsson's best-selling novel, the film version of the intricate and gripping story does justice to the narrative. The movie's biggest performance is without a doubt Rooney Mara as Lisbeth Salander. She has completely inhabited the character, who is both complex and mysterious, and whose role is both delicate and wild. It is a highly seductive performance, and Mara's depth and intensity in the role are unusual. The film is a masterpiece of actor Daniel Red; he shows a perfect balance between power and vulnerability, which makes him sympathetic and understandable. The chemistry between Mara and Red is indescribable, and their scenes together are explosive. The director, David Fincher, captures the dark, hard mood of the novel admirably. The film is beautifully shot, and the use of lighting and color adds to the atmosphere. The pacing is excellent, and it is always clear and interesting without boring moments. The most impressive thing about 'The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo' is the storyline. The plot is filled with many surprises that constantly keep you guessing. The mystery unfolds slowly, and you get to know the characters and their dark secrets. The tension increases continuously and leads to a surprising and satisfying ending. The film also deals with important and delicate topics such as violence against women and corruption in the legal system, and this with a thought-provoking and unshirkable approach that sheds light on the dark underbelly of society. These themes are handled with care and respect, which makes the film even more impressive. While 'The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo' is a wonderful film, it is not for everyone. There are violent scenes and disturbing images that some people may find difficult to see. But if you can endure the nastiness, this is a movie that you absolutely must see. The whole film is well made and intense, and if you love dark and exciting thrillers, you should not miss it.

Heist film: exciting and entertaining, and a worthy sequel to the original Ocean's Eleven, bringing back the charm and wit of the first. The whole cast, including George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Matt Damon and many others, are reunited and give sparkling performances. The plot is based on the revenge of the gang led by Dante (Clooney) against the scheming casino owner Willy Bank (Pacino), who betrayed their friend Ruben (Gould). The group plans an elaborate and cunning plan to rob Bank's new casino on the first day of the gala evening, relying on each of their special skills. The plot of the robbery is a strong point of the film: it is ingeniously thought out, with each member of the gang having his role and a purpose. The film keeps you in suspense as the robbery proceeds, with unexpected twists. The action is well paced, never boring, but not hurried, and the dialogue is filled with witty remarks that make the film all the more enjoyable. Clooney, Pitt and Damon have made a great effort to get back into their roles and their banter and camaraderie are just as enjoyable as in the first film. The appearance of Al Pacino as the villain brings a new dynamic to the group and he is both threatening and charming. The whole picture is filmed with flair, capturing the bright lights and bright colors of Las Vegas. The set and cinematography are excellent, making the whole environment look attractive, and the music, especially the music by David Holmes, is evocative and adds to the whole cold and sophisticated atmosphere. Although there are no great new ideas, the film is well crafted and entertaining. It successfully brings back the spirit of the first and offers an enjoyable, light-hearted and fun experience. The fans of the series will not be disappointed, and newcomers will find themselves easily attracted to the world of Dante and his gang.

‘Borat: Cultural Learnings of America for Make Benefit Glorious Nation of Kazakhstan’ is a satirical masterpiece, pushing the boundaries between humour and satire. Borat Sagdiyev, a fictional character played by Sacha Baron Cohen, is both sardonic and deeply perceptive. The film follows Borat as he tours the USA and meets ordinary people who are not aware that they are participants in a fake documentary. Through his outrageous and insulting behaviour Borat uncovers the underlying prejudices and ignorance in American society. The film is cleverly written, it makes you laugh, and it makes you think. Borat’s performance is brilliant and enthralling. As the film is a supposedly documentary it is based on the reactions of the people who are not aware that they are participants in a fake documentary. He is completely in character, always delivering his lines with impeccable comic timing and physical comedy. His ability to remain in character even in the most difficult situations shows how brilliantly he combines his skills as an actor and comedian. It is important to remember that the film is a satire. It uses exaggeration and shock tactics to highlight the absurdity of prejudice and ignorance. The film is not to be taken literally but as a comment on society. ‘Borat: Cultural Learnings of America for Make Benefit Glorious Nation of Kazakhstan’ is a brave and controversial film which challenges its audience to confront uncomfortable truths. It is a must see film for anyone who appreciates black comedy and is willing to engage in deeper discussion of social issues.

The film, Peaceful Warrior, is an intriguing, thought-provoking film that mixes drama with spirituality to create a unique and compelling story. The film is based on the autobiography of the same name by Dan Millman, and is the story of the journey of a gymnast, Dan, who is looking for meaning and purpose in his life. Actor Scott Mechlowicz gives an exceptional performance as Dan, effortlessly conveying the complexities and internal conflicts of the character. Through a series of encounters with a mysterious gas station attendant, played by Nick Nolte, Dan begins to question his beliefs, to challenge his limitations, and to embrace a new philosophy, which transforms his life. The film beautifully explores themes of self-discovery, personal growth, and the power of the human spirit, encouraging the viewer to reflect on their own lives and question their choices, and encouraging them to seek a deeper understanding of themselves and their place in the world. Director Victor Salva has created a stunning film, which showcases gymnastics as a metaphor for life. The film is visually stunning, with breathtaking gymnastics sequences, which are not only impressive, but also serve as powerful metaphors for the obstacles and challenges we all face in life. What sets this film apart from other spiritually based films is its ability to blend spirituality and philosophy with an engaging storyline. The script is beautifully written, and combines moments of humour, drama, and deep wisdom. The dialogue between Dan and the gas station attendant is especially memorable, and contains many wise and poignant lines, which stay with the viewer long after the film ends. It inspires the viewer to question societal expectations and to find happiness and peace within themselves. This film is an inspiration to all who see it.

‘We’re the Millers’ is a fun and amusing film that’ll have you laughing out loud from start to finish. The film is based on a group of crooks who go undercover as a regular American family in order to smuggle drugs across the Mexican border.
